planned.name: Free Games Cheker
planned.description:
Search game stores such as GOG, Epic Games and Steam for paid games that have gone free.

The bot should then send an embed with info of the game fetched from the store page  as well as a button link to the store to claim

```
planned.name: Library backup
planned.description:
---

### **Overview & Purpose**

The `/library_backup` command acts as your **personal archive generator**, letting you export your tracked series collection into different formats for safekeeping, analysis, or sharing. It isnâ€™t just about having files â€” itâ€™s about **owning your data**.

---

### **Functional Description**

#### **Export Types**

* **JSON** â†’ Developer-friendly, structured, and lightweight.
* **CSV** â†’ Spreadsheet-ready, great for statistics and progress charts.
* **XML** â†’ Structured for compatibility with third-party apps.
* **YAML (Optional)** â†’ Minimal and human-readable.
* **Plain Text (Optional)** â†’ Nostalgic diary-style list.

#### **Scope of Export**

* **Full Library** â†’ Every tracked entry.
* **Status Filter** â†’ Completed, Watching/Reading, Dropped, Paused, Planned.
* **Type Filter** â†’ Anime only, Manga only, Light Novels only.
* **Tag Filter** â†’ Export works tagged with user-defined labels (favorites, backlog, etc.).

#### **Metadata Included**

* Title
* Status
* Progress (episodes/chapters)
* Ratings
* Notes / Tags
* Start & finish dates
* Reread/rewatch counts
* Last updated

---

### **Customization**

* **Format selection** â†’ JSON, CSV, XML, TXT.
* **Scope selection** â†’ All series, completed only, etc.
* **Extended metadata** â†’ Toggle for including advanced fields.
* **Delivery method** â†’ DM (private) or channel (public share).

---

# **Visualizations & Aesthetics**

---

### **1. Command Trigger**

When you type `/library_backup`, an **embed panel** appears guiding you:

```
